ASC guideline¶

In this section, we will provide more detailed descriptions and examples of the ASC types that we included for the current study. Note that all examples in the following subsections come from the training section of the treebank.

ATTR¶

  • Attributive ASC

  • Form: Subj Vcopular NP/AdjP/PP

  • Meaning: Xtheme is Yattribute

  • Examples

    • [it]theme was [an evolution]NPattribute

    • [I]theme am [sure]AdjPattribute

    • [your dog]theme … is [in the same room]PPattribute

INTRAN_S¶

  • Intransitive simple ASC

  • Form: Subj V

  • Meaning: Xagent acts; Xtheme happens

  • Examples

    • [I]agent am working from our Hong Kong office

    • [Martin’s box]theme is working wonderfully

INTRAN_MOT¶

  • Intransitive motion ASC

  • Form: Subj V Obl

  • Meaning: Xmover/theme moves Ypath

  • Examples

    • [the morbidity rate]theme is going [up]AdvPRARGM-DIR

    • [I]theme went [across the bay]PPgoal

INTRAN_RES¶

  • Intransitive resultative ASC

  • Form: Subj V RP

  • Meaning: Xpatient becomes Ystate

  • Example

    • [the spine]patient will become [flexible]result

TRAN_S¶

  • Transitive simple ASC

  • Form: Subj V Obj

  • Meaning: Xagent acts on Ypatient/theme

  • Examples (may include subcategories)

    • [they]agent are targeting [ambulances]theme

    • mental activities: [I]agent thought [the US government was looking for me]theme

    • state: [I]experiencer love [my gym]stimulus

    • communication: [he]agent claimed [that they have the means to stage]topic

DITRAN¶

  • Ditransitive ASC

  • Form: Subj V Obj1 Obj2

  • Meaning: Xagent causes Yrecipient to receive Ztheme

  • Examples (may include subcategories)

    • [you]agent feed [your rabbits]recipient [non-veg items]theme

    • communication: [I]agent told [the little girl]recipient [that she would have to accompany me to school]topic

CAUS_MOT¶

  • Caused-motion ASC

  • Form: Subj V Obj Obl

  • Meaning: Xagent causes Ytheme to move Zpath

  • Examples

    • [I]agent took [it]theme [there]destination

    • [the body]agent brings [stability]theme [to the region]goal

TRAN_RES¶

  • Transitive resultative ASC

  • Form: Subj V Obj RP

  • Meaning: Xagent> causes Ypatient/theme to become Zresult

  • Examples

    • [the vessel]agent changed [its name]patient at sea to [Horizon]result

    • [No preacher]agent has ever blow [himself]theme [up]C-V

PASSIVE¶

  • Passive ASC

  • Form: Subj aux V past participle (by-PP)

  • Meaning: Xtheme undergo V (by Yagent)

  • Examples (may include subcategories)

    • [you]theme are invitedVpassive to join with members of the forum

    • coinedVpassive [by Bill Gates]agent

    • past participle pre-modifiers: overlookedVpassive [problem]theme

    • past participle post-modifiers: she guided me through a very difficult period dealing with a family member’s suicide, coupledVpassive with elder abuse

Notes¶

  • Each ASC type is tagged next to the main verb head of argument structure construction (e.g., He sneezedCAUS_MOT the foam off the table).

  • Multiple, overlaping ASCs may be present in a particular utterance. For example, a clausal argument of an ASC will represent an additional ASC (e.g., [But the best way isATTR [to useTRAN_S coupons]]).

Abbreviations¶
